807F9D5CC1044516AEC9CC28681FCEBF.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

E8F6B6871DFF4CADAD271B3CB8200EFA.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

6D8737C67C7A4800BCD61BF3A249D292.description: Report - speaking clearly at an understandable pace - on a topic or text or when presenting an opinion, sequencing ideas logically, using appropriate facts, and descriptive details to support main ideas or themes.

DB402542DB2749C6A10A2DAAEA66461B.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

9C354532F3AF4DAF83667F294BE039CE.description: Summarize information presented in a variety of media and formats.

E50E523964264693B1F884BB744433F8.description: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

C9109D1F129A4F5AB2833177BFDA2EF1.description: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

4A28D19398734ED2BA8CA679547642E4.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

7D12E73FA2294C779EEF5C34AFFE7F30.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

8B662C32EDE64BEEA086F2FBAECED443.description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases as found in grade level appropriate texts, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

6AE551C5E4F0497399E0829A42A20B01.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

49E2A83BE48740F280FA38138C19AB41.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

9EDB15FA8A1D470DA77AB177DF86B7FE.description: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

2FEEB69231AC45F2BB5F522126DA26DA.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

3CEEF4BE2A46456685903F8CE79EFE5A.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

C358729986744A6797341BA4722F88F5.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

5185914481F744308C5E1EFEBFD19371.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

64A9BCB8445F42DDA8D93280AE2DDFDE.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

C0E5220A742F4B16A640B781ADBE72A4.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

651E06F1D894481B928DA013A547B252.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

490A3D59EB074F39882745D787124209.description: Identify figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

B77907FCDA18488D8ED9F43B5B487622.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, such as analogies, and nuances in word meanings. Clarification: The concept of analogy is introduced but not expected for mastery in grade 5.

C01576A7059247BB88378802C1790176.description: Use dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses, both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

FF90FA23DE0142F3A00919C109543282.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

10A6AB43984741A1990C6E326D281991.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

69861B205D864A58990FA490FC4C757E.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

38F5C3B77C0B4484975D4F7B1E159527.description: Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

D1957CC3A884402FA5E844A9B7D5D1E9.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

79ED17A682C147029E40BEBB71A2CA7D.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, or reading.

BB0657D47B25448CB6E92FA70DDB97A3.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

54AFE9E0D39748B990AE20F2B0815939.description: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

2D21AAC49EDA4CCEA813E6CCE171CBE0.description: Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

6D428577EB454286B8932C226A192DCB.description: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

34620FA739BE45A7B2B6C67AA6FCADFC.description: Use conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

5E36A28E21B04E30B55CD6E71A2457A8.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

0901671826A14BEE99354998E2F1169D.description: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

34357856BE0D4687ADF3A6326746A420.description: Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

8D8A2C70B2BC4601A7B0960BC8319DE9.description: Identify and explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.

74EBEF0378494F64BA4B620A72BCF5E9.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

C00F6D701D3A45A9B23B494154B1D562.description: Students will be able to write three five sentence paragraphs, including a introductory paragraph, a supporting body paragraph and a fully-developed concluding parapgraph on a topic that uses supportive detail, correct capitalization, end punctuation and transitional words.

7298DE8E913B4F6A97318048A3B5CDB5.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences  including for enjoyment and self-expression.

9E768286689D474F8567B290916A4EFE.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. Clarification 1: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]”). Clarification 2: Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]”).

46C9545866474E8A8F6231047F42544D.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

FC4AA6934DB949A199C1072FCD803A06.description: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic. Clarification 1: Teachers should monitor appropriate use of search terms and process in using search engines; i.e. Google.

1E3AAACA1A594635AC913A504D7A52DE.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

85FB764B569D4B72A33CB950EAAD199A.description: Students will use technology tools, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

BE735B81C4234339BA5DD9DF841176EB.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

7921F9CC1C174E2A8C3FD4ECDD90DC1E.description: Write a three-paragraph narrative to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. Clarification 1:  Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally. Clarification 2: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events. Clarification 4: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.  Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

50F5A2812BD94600ADB7D5727018F41F.description: Write three paragraph informative or explanatory piece to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly and that includes a well-constructed concluding paragraph. Clarification 1: Introduce. Clarification 4: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.   Clarification 5: Write a concluding paragraph related to the information or explanation presented.

C1424B083C914CDE9B3C1567206CCC80.description: Write three paragraph opinion piece on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information, introduces the construct of a concluding paragraph using summary, restatement, and a statement indicating reason for the opinion. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose. (Introductory paragraph). Clarification 2: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details. (Body paragraph). Clarification 3: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically). Clarification 4: Provide a concluding paragraph related to the opinion presented. (Concluding paragraph)

F3AB62BFFD554296AC2E326A1A5544E4.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the 5 grade level.

3BF79A1D459B46A08CB658C5E1DE2404.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

472F43A6605344AE813A5A0818F5F546.description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

7AABFE3F09234B36B6E46DD031D217A3.description: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

D3F5B322555449F3891AD90E0B4C5B1E.description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

A07BEF5EE47A45D38741AC25EEB3888E.description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

E5D3CDDEF88743258CE94598F5EF4AB0.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

9FDD75FC575147F78D7390C84147BD3D.description: Summarize a given text in a five sentence paragraph highlighting theme, characters, and setting, including one text citation in support.

BC1C7E2B702F417AAEF2FB3AE6889439.description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

87DCC7A616DE4FA8807BF6D857EEAF66.description: Cite accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

A105DF4DFE4143E2AF5AFB23A4A04538.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic.

C411187479A142E1812F764DDC9CCD7A.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the 5 grade level text complexity band independently and proficiently.

1A35D87ED19943C985D58D4AA0B39484.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

1E146F54243044BC944945AB3863AEA6.description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

6DF6994BE52E4341AA9B464C92C2E66B.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

D19C167A5B0646D89850DA1DC6B339B1.description: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate the answer to a question or to solve a problem.

CA287E0F36F0431DB8534F0D6E92485B.description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the perspective they represent.

2DD0879F71AD4F18BB801458BEE89837.description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

A4AF1C5768AB4B8894BF2742D12E08F8.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

C4480AB3CE4D432399E93B39B1D562BE.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

F098E540D3CF42A3AAF010A611F1DF37.description: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details.

C991644C084F499C8CD871051A331D8B.description: Cite accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

13D28F1EEB13449695C6FC22E3DE85BA.description: Students will be able to fluently read connected text at a rate of 146 Words Correct Per Minute (WCPM) with greater than 96% accuracy (50th percentile).  For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

E82A8A752F48413E9AA29B821C3E8A9A.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

391E0CD4A8F34F81934D40BDAC46A60C.description: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

9059BF408E024A3390A3404529EE90B8.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

4390487C5D76477FA41DECF88375EFE4.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

EF500868C4F644DE8F2E7A02EA4BE350.description: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context and in application.

D17812D282F1495EB68221D8FAE36897.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
